In response to "paerchu" a couple of posts above, none of the movies on Pirate Bay have "perfect" resolution. I am on an 80" LCD and an experienced eye can definitely and very clearly tell the difference between 1080P from a BluRay compared to 1080P from BOZX's highest quality rips. These are compressed files so there is no way they will be exactly the same as watching from the disk, and on an 80" even sitting 14' away from the screen, the quality is not even close ...it's closer to 1080i, which is pretty much worse than 720P. Nevertheless, the movies are still very enjoyable ...especially the 3D ones. So I am not complaining one bit, especially since they are FREE! :-)

But let's get one thing straight once and for all - BOZX's (or PublicHD's) rips are intended for home entertainment systems (thus the surround sound/larger files) and YiFy's are ideal for portable devices (stereo sound, smaller files). And with BOZX's files, you do not want to stream the file wirelessly because the bitrate is too high. You will get stuttering audio /video during the "busier" scenes unless your wireless signal is consistently above 20-30+ MBPS (depending on the movie begin watched) .

BOZX = the best, period.
